title: What the Patriots need to do in the off-season, according to readers
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Readers call for Patriots to improve their offensive line after Super Bowl LX loss to the Seattle Seahawks.
Many respondents highlight offensive line struggles as the primary reason for the Patriots' Super Bowl loss.
Suggestions include adding talent in the receiver corps and bolstering both offensive and defensive lines.

title: Springfield dry sausage plant to close, cutting 190 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Smithfield Foods will close its Springfield dry sausage plant by August, eliminating 190 jobs in Massachusetts.
Smithfield will shift Springfield plant production to other facilities and offer staff transition support and job opportunities.
The plant closure follows a $140,000 EPA settlement on Clean Air Act violations, unrelated to the shutdown decision.

title: What Stefon Diggs said about his Patriots future
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs plans to remain with the New England Patriots next season but acknowledges that the decision isn't entirely his.
Diggs signed a three-year contract with the Patriots last offseason worth up to $69 million, extending through 2027.
Diggs is facing assault and strangulation charges from an alleged incident; he has denied the allegations with Patriots' support.

title: Prosecutor who tried Brian Walshe for murder enters Norfolk DA race
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Greg Connor enters the race for Norfolk District Attorney after prosecuting the Brian Walshe murder case.
Connor, a Milton Democrat, has filed campaign paperwork and will step down from the DA's office on March 6.
Connor joins a crowded Democratic field vying to replace outgoing Norfolk DA Michael Morrissey, who won't seek reelection.

title: Red Sox land Caleb Durbin in six-player trade with Brewers
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The Boston Red Sox acquired Caleb Durbin from the Milwaukee Brewers in a six-player trade announced Monday.
Boston also received Andruw Monasterio, Anthony Seigler, and a 2026 draft pick from Milwaukee.
The Red Sox sent Kyle Harrison, Shane Drohan, and David Hamilton to the Brewers in the exchange.

title: Former Jets player charged with killing woman from Framingham
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Former NFL player Darron Lee charged with first-degree murder of Gabriella Perpetuo in Tennessee on Feb. 5.
Authorities found signs of domestic violence, including blood splatter and a stab wound on victim Perpetuo.
Lee is being held in Hamilton County Jail; his court appearance is scheduled for Wednesday.

title: World Cup plans at risk as Foxborough pushes for security funding
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Foxborough officials demand $7.7 million upfront for police and safety operations for World Cup games at Gillette Stadium.
Massachusetts is allocated $47 million in federal funds for security, but Foxborough's requested amount likely won't be fully granted.
The Foxborough Select Board threatens to withhold stadium's entertainment license unless funding issue is resolved by March 17.

title: Marlborough hospital evacuated after ‘Code Black’ shutdown
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass Memorial's Marlborough campus evacuated over 70 patients due to a 'Code Black' from heating and water system failures.
The heating system failure was caused by a valve break, resulting in flooding and a stop to new emergency department arrivals.
Marlborough Hospital remains open for walk-in emergencies, but all inpatient services and most outpatient services are temporarily closed.

title: Patriots rookie Kyle Williams chased down a streaker at Super Bowl LX
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Kyle Williams stopped a streaker during the fourth quarter of Super Bowl LX against the Seahawks.
The streaker, a shirtless man, was arrested on suspicion of trespassing and field intrusion by Santa Clara Police.
Williams is noted for his speed, having run a 4.40-second 40-yard dash at the 2025 NFL Scouting Combine.

title: Offseason primer: Here’s a quick look at Patriots’ list of 2026 draft picks, pending free agents
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots have 11 picks in the 2026 NFL Draft, including a first-round pick at 31st overall.
New England is projected to have over $42 million in cap space for the 2026 offseason.
Pending free agents include Austin Hooper, K'Lavon Chaisson, and Khyiris Tonga, among others.
